edu.rit.draw.item

Class Wedge

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.draw.item.DrawingItem
      • edu.rit.draw.item.OutlinedItem
        • edu.rit.draw.item.FilledItem
          • edu.rit.draw.item.ShapeItem
            • edu.rit.draw.item.Wedge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Externalizable, Serializable

    public class Wedge
extends ShapeItem
implements Externalizable
    Class Wedge provides a DrawingItem that is a circular wedge. The wedge has an outline consisting of two rays from the wedge's center point joined by a circular arc. The wedge has a filled interior. The wedge is defined by the following attributes:

    • center() -- The wedge's center point. The default is (0,0).

    • radius() -- The wedge's radius. The default is 1.

    • start() -- The wedge's starting angle in radians. This is the angle from the positive X axis to the wedge's starting point. The default is 0.

    • extent() -- The wedge's angular extent in radians. This is the angle from the wedge's starting point to the wedge's ending point. The default is π/2.

    Angles increase from the positive X axis towards the positive Y axis. Since the positive X axis points to the right and the positive Y axis points down, angles increase in the clockwise direction. (This is the opposite of the usual mathematical convention, where the positive Y axis points upwards.)

    The static defaultCenter(), defaultRadius(), defaultStart(), and defaultExtent() methods are provided to set the default center point, radius, starting angle, and angular extent. If the center point, radius, starting angle, or angular extent is not specified, the current default center point, radius, starting angle, or angular extent is used.

    See Also:
